title: ag.algebraic geometry - $l$-adic Galois representations factor through a common finite quotient
body: Let $X$ be a smooth projective geometrically connected variety over $\mathbb{Q}$ . Assume that for some $m>0$ we have $h^{i, 2m-i}(X)=0$ unless $i=m$ . Does there exist a number field $E$ such that for all but finitely many primes $l$ the homomorphism $\mathrm{Gal}(\overline{\mathbb{Q}}/\mathbb{Q}) \to GL(H^{2m}(X_{\overline{\mathbb{Q}}}, \mathbb{Q}_l(m)))$ is the composition of the natural map $\mathrm{Gal}(\overline{\mathbb{Q}}/\mathbb{Q})\to \mathrm{Gal}(E/\mathbb{Q})$ and an injective map $\mathrm{Gal}(E/\mathbb{Q})\to GL(H^{2m}(X_{\overline{\mathbb{Q}}}, \mathbb{Q}_l(m)))$ ? ag.algebraic-geometry arithmetic-geometry etale-cohomology galois-representations p-adic-hodge-theory Share Cite Improve this question Follow edited Aug 5, 2020 at 15:52 asked Aug 5, 2020 at 10:19 user158636 $\endgroup$ 8 $\begingroup$ Are you willing to assume the Tate conjecture? $\endgroup$ Daniel Litt –  Daniel Litt 2020-08-05 13:17:57 +00:00 Commented Aug 5, 2020 at 13:17 1 $\begingroup$ Sure, then the image of the cycle class map gives a natural Q-structure (even Z-structure) after twisting by Q_l(m). $\endgroup$ Daniel Litt –  Daniel Litt 2020-08-05 13:49:47 +00:00 Commented Aug 5, 2020 at 13:49 $\begingroup$ You're supposed to take the Tate conjecture over some finite extensions $K$ of $\mathbb Q$ such that the representation is trivial after a Tate twist over $K$. Then the Galois invariant subspace is the whole space. Alternately, because you began with an assumption about Hodge numbers, you can use the Hodge conjecture. $\endgroup$ Will Sawin –  Will Sawin 2020-08-05 15:28:38 +00:00 Commented Aug 5, 2020 at 15:28 1 $\begingroup$ I don't think so - How could it be? $\endgroup$ Will Sawin –  Will Sawin 2020-08-05 16:15:43 +00:00 Commented Aug 5, 2020 at 16:15 2 $\begingroup$ You don't need the Hodge or Tate conjecture, only Deligne's conjecture that all Hodge classes are absolutely Hodge. $\endgroup$ anon –  anon 2020-08-06 17:25:45 +00:00 Commented Aug 6, 2020 at 17:25  |  Show 3 more comments 0 Sorted by: Reset to default Highest score (default) Date modified (newest first) Date created (oldest first) You must log in to answer this question.
